website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for those new to Dynatrap who want to give it a try, or for some smaller and indoor areas; though its power and space is limited, it's a great deal.
pros: The smallest, most affordable model the company manufactures
300 ft. range is practical for indoor use and small outdoor areas
Lightweight and easy to place almost anywhere you need to control insects
cons: Fan isn't as strong as that of larger traps
Not ideal for attracting flying pests from longer distances
May require frequent emptying in areas with a lot of bugs

customer_reviews.title: excellent. Bad reviews probably due to buyer not opening ...
customer_reviews.text: First; cheap for small area, product concept; excellent. Bad reviews probably due to buyer not opening the top part of the equipment ; the instructions are not clear that the opaque white segments have to be opened in order for the unit to suck the victims in. I had the same bad results when I first used it. I'm in Paia Maui with several species of mosquitos...unit attracts all of them with out attractant....an attractant would probably attract even more.....anyway see pix of 24 hour operation....aloha g
customer_reviews.author: Aloharabbit

customer_reviews.title: Six of one half that of the other.
customer_reviews.text: Mine caught mostly moths, but it caught a decent number of mosquitoes as well. Just make sure you clean it out before it gets too full, or the motor will burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Fitz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT !
customer_reviews.text: Living in south Florida, we have LOTS of mosquitoes. This little machine attracts them and does away with them. It has worked well in our home but you have to have the lights off for it to work best. We had so many, it took a while to eliminate them but now we are free of the little vampires and I have no more bites. YEA! Mine is about a year old and still working fine. I order a second for our granddaughter and the cord did not work. I contacted the company and they very nicely and promptly replaced it in quick order. Was great to have a customer service that made me smile! THANKS DYNATRAP!
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: A must have in Florida.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Been using it for a few days and have captured lots of mosquitoes. It's quiet and I like that it doesn't use chemicals, so it's great for inside the house. Kids seem to like it because every morning, mine wakes up to see what's inside. The fan and other parts seem to be secure enough to keep little fingers safe. I am looking at getting a second one for near the front door.
customer_reviews.author: Cdr9er

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 days and have had great results. I saw a lot of Mosquitos dead in the trap, so I feel I'm getting my money out of it. It did catch other bugs, but no bee's or wasps.
customer_reviews.author: ROMFox

customer_reviews.title: has not caught a mosquito yet.
customer_reviews.text: has not caught a mosquito yet, however, my daughters' continue to get bitten in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Gummy BearTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito's buzzing in your ear?  Then get one of these !
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 different types of mosquito traps, and have used them over a period of several months. Of the 3, one of them stopped working after a short period of time, the 2nd didn't seem to attract the mosquitos (they were still buzzing in my ear). The Dyna Trap worked the best, plug it in and go to sleep.... any mosquito(s) in the room magically stopped bothering me. The Dyna Trap is worth it's price for a good night's sleep !
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito trap it isn't. The first night, it ...
customer_reviews.text: Mosquito trap it isn't. The first night, it trapped a whole bunch of little white insects (I don't know what they were) but didn't kill them because when I opened the bottom to check them out, they all flew away. No mosquitoes though and it surely didn't kill anything.
customer_reviews.author: Shogun

customer_reviews.title: Gets moths which is what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a silent bug killer for our garage. We used to have a bug zapper but our dog was afraid of the noise and wouldn't go out anymore so we had to think of something else. I personally am terrified of moths and we were hoping this product would suck in all the mothss that came in from the garage. The sucking action isn't very strong but it totally works! They are attracted to the light and get sucked into the lower cage and die quickly. We are happy with it, it's nearly silent, we leave it on all the time and we get a few moths every night. Getting another one for the basement!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: It works just as described. We had a TON of mosquitoes at our back door and placed this right under the awning near the door. It made a huge difference in a short time. I just don't enjoy cleaning it out. UPDATE: Ours lasted less than a year, but I purchased again because it did work well while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Anitra

customer_reviews.title: Good tech, but...
customer_reviews.text: Got this April 10 2019 and has been running 24/7 as recommended by the instructions. Was working like a champ and killing bugs, then the bulb started fading and is now not lighting at all. It says it’s rated to 20k hours, that’s 2+ years of constant operation. So I looked up the warranty, which is one year, and it does not cover the light bulb... and the bulb is not replaceable. Loved it til the bulb died and now all I have is a suction fan with no lure. The technology works... get one with a replaceable bulb though.
customer_reviews.author: Juan & Angie Svenningsen

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do what it said it would and stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April, it is now September and it has stopped working. This barely made it to 5mths and when it was working it wasn’t the greatest. This was a complete waste of money as it didn’t do exactly what it said it would. It caught more dust than bugs and when it was work it was making a buzzing sound after a little bit of having it then when the sound when away so did the life of the product. If I could return this for my money I’d be doing so but unfortunately the time frame has passed, I guess that’s the gimmick of the whole product.
customer_reviews.author: DCY

customer_reviews.title: Pesticide free, and super efficient way to get rid of extra gnats in your home!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is awesome! Catches fruit flies from all around the house, and it's easy to twist off and empty and put right back on. Makes just a slight fan noise (nothing too distracting) has a soothing blue light to it if you see it in the dark. It's kept me from having to poison my plants to get rid of the gnats that keep living in them. It's certainly not going to eradicate the issue itself, but it goes a long way in luring in hundreds of strays while I deal with the plants themselves. Unfortunately this doesn't happen overnight as anybody who gets these annoying gnats knows!
customer_reviews.author: Wilyry

customer_reviews.title: I had some doubts, but it does catch mosquitoes and other small flies
customer_reviews.text: I have been having problems with mosquitoes and small flies in my house lately, so I just purchased this and set it up indoors for just 24hrs, and it already caught a decent amount. I am still skeptical that it produces any significant amount of CO2 (from "ambient organic matter" as the included literature claims), but regardless I am satisfied that it caught a dozen or so bugs in one day (many more than I had even noticed flying around when in the same main living room area). I imagine it would collect much more if I actually used it outside, most of them coming in from around my front door. I'm already considering getting another for that.
customer_reviews.author: A Human

customer_reviews.title: It works as described in my garage.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my two cars garage in a heavily mosquito infested area, as long as my garage door is closed I no longer get bites. If I open the garage door and they get in, by the next day they’re all dead in the trap. I may get the larger outdoor one also since I’ve learned they do work.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Beard

customer_reviews.title: Nope.  Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK!! There were so many mosquitos in our house and we were getting eaten alive so I kept trying by leaving the trap on non stop and trying different locations in the house. After a week and not a single one caught (yet plenty of new bites) I gave up. Returned it and got my money back. We're back to using bug spray with DEET, the only thing that actually works!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Fewer bites!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second Dynatrap. The fan that sucks the little critters in, went. Almost exactly one year of continuous Florida use. Used outside, in a mobile home park. We were able to hang it on a plant hook, right outside the kitchen door. It really does the job. While replacing an appliance in one year is NOT ideal, this really does help and is definitely worth the replacement price! Think about that next time you start scratching and feel those unmistakable bumps. It's such a quiet unit and extremely light to hang. If mosquitoes go for you or a loved one, order this now.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Greatest thing ever for mosquitoes and gnats. I have 3 spread through my house. Not sure why, but for the last several years we get a swarm of mosquitoes in the spring and early summer. We would be up all night fighting and getting eaten alive. Bought one last year and it made a huge difference. Added 2 more this year and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: amy gauna

customer_reviews.title: Buh Bye Mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: This works wonderfully! We are in an apartment while our new house is being built and there is standing water in the courtyard close to our apartment that the office is not taking care of for whatever reason. Well sure enough it's become a breeding ground for mosquitoes and every time we would open the front door of the apartment at least 3 would get in. We used to have to "hunt" mosquitoes every night...but now this amazing trap takes care of all of it for us. It also catches fruit flies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  bye bye nats!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my RV and I get this little tiny nats that are a pain to get rid of and very annoying. They CAN get through the screen on this, but I cut a round sticky trap on paper out to fit in the bottom and it works perfect! Sucks them in, they stick to the sticky trap and done! I have no more nats in my RV but the sticky trap inside this is full of them! I bought a second one and have them both running 24/7 and not a single critter is flying around here anymore! So happy I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Reviews4U

customer_reviews.title: 3 Days - Caught 2 and Half Bugs
customer_reviews.text: Not very great testimony when this unit with its 25 percent one star rating percentage ranks among the "highest" rated. Still....... I was searching for a nontoxic method to capture the bumper crop of box elder bugs that set up shop in my Minnesota basement this winter. The unit claims to attract Asian beetles which in my Mechanical Engineering brain were close enough to give the unit a try. I ran the trap for 3 days straight and got 2 and a half bugs. Don't know where the other half is.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Actually works.  It's not magic, but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I have kids. This means my sliding glass door is often open and the mozzies come in. I put this thing on my kitchen bar (not near the door so it attracts the critters) and keep the lights dim about the house and this things picks up the bugs while we're waching TV....and they aren't eating on ME! The only issue I have is that I can't convince my family to close the trap before they unplug it...but that's my problem not the product!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Mains

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK ON NO SEE UMS
customer_reviews.text: Although prominently recommended, it is CERTAINLY NOT THE MOST EFFECTIVE METHOD OF KILLIJNG NO SEE UMS......The machine killed ONE in a month. Yes, it is correctly set although the directions left much to be desired. My home is infested with the bugs and I am being bit as the machine hums away . I really would like my money back or even better get a machine that does work. It breaks my heart that my last hope for deliverance from these nasty, painful bugs has not worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work great, but don't get them wet
customer_reviews.text: NOT water resistant! These work great, but don't get them wet. We fried one so learned the hard way they are not meant to be left outside in the weather. We now have one in the garage that collects a lot of insects nightly. Definitely attractive to insects,traps them as advertised, and they can't get out. Easy to empty, you will be amazed how many there are when emptying. Make sure to close vent if you turn off or any insects still alive may fly out. As long as it's a covered area that rain won't soak these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: there are fewer flying around.  silent.  UPDATE, JUST BOUGHT 2ND ONE.  LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 8-29-2018: I BOUGHT A SECOND ONE, the first was so good. love the fact you can close the apertures and turn it off to move it. turn on, reopen the slits, and you are back in business. ORIGINAL:thought it would trap more, but there are fewer flying around. silent. looks good.. UPDATE(about a month or less) stays on 24/7, silent, the number of bugs trapped grows daily. never see flies anymore inside. i am in and out with a dog all day, and with potatoes and bananas regularly, i always have a few flying around. not anymore..
customer_reviews.author: fred here

customer_reviews.title: This works great. It's not perfect but better than the other ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's not perfect but better than the other solutions we tried. We are trying to get rid of these small black fruit fly type bugs that are flying around our sink. We have tried everything (literally) and this is the best solution yet. It's not "whisper quiet" as some have said, but it's in our kitchen and it's far enough away that it doesn't bother us.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not many mosquitos but has caught lots of other annoying bugs
customer_reviews.text: Has caught a TON of bugs. Only 2 mosquitos, though. It is durable for a plastic item and survived dropping a few feet off a stand without so much as a scuff. Very quiet fan. A solar power option would be awesome for positioning it - a little difficult to find a good spot for it (especially when the directions suggest keeping it away from occupied areas... you know, like all the patios, decks, etc near your house where the outlets are). It has a large plug I wouldn't want to leave exposed at the end of an extension chord.
customer_reviews.author: warthorn

customer_reviews.title: Seriously consider an alternative if your looking to control mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: So in the hopes of keeping flying bugs at bay in the house, yes it does catch some flying bugs but what it DOES NOT catch is tiger mosquitos. Bought it specifically thinking that it could atleast catch some mosquitos but not a single one was ever caught in the 2 weeks we had it in the screen porch, with the screen door open to see results. Got a bunch of moths and that’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS !!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works perfectly. Just follow the instructions and it does all the work. It's small so adhere to the max square feet and it's better off inside inclosed spaces. MUCH MORE EFFICENT THAN A BUG ZAPPER!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great at night at trapping those pesky bugs on your porch
customer_reviews.text: It does work and do it's job. Doesn't stop all the no-seeum from getting you, but it seems to help quite a lot in my screened in lanai in Florida. We empty is every few weeks and surprised to see how much it does capture and dry out. Very easy to use and clean out. Barely uses any electricity to run (maybe a few bucks a year).
customer_reviews.author: notap

customer_reviews.title: Great little product but it quit working in less than 30 days.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived 5-4-20 and we plugged it in immediately. It began working immediately, too. Every morning we had to empty the trap because there were lots of captured bugs. Two days ago the fan quit working. The fan is an integral function as it literally sucks the insects into the trap. We waited a day to get permission to return it. We got permission to return it to the manufacturers agent but have to pay to ship it back. Doesn’t seem fair to me...and it’s sure not the Amazon way. I’ll be looking for a new trap...one that’s supported by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: razzinaz

customer_reviews.title: Does not attract mosqitoes
customer_reviews.text: We've had one on a screened in back porch for a good 18 months and I assumed it worked. It does catch a lot of little bugs. However, I bought this one for the inside of the house. I had a mosquito buzzing my ear in my office, so I put the unit in my 10 x 12 office, door closed for 48 hours. When I went back in my office, that mosquito was in my ear in no time! I checked the trap, no other mosquito there. Worthless!
customer_reviews.author: paul Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my garage, where I have a mosquito issue. The winged spawn of satan congregate around my work bench. So I shut the garage door, turn off all the lights, and put the trap in the center of the garage, under the door opener. Today, still getting attacked in the same area by blood suckers. There are bugs in the trap. Some are probably mosquitos. But this isn't effective enough on its own. I'm going to add one of those C02 cube things to see if that draws them in. Not very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Its works well but now the motor is real noisy
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well in the begining but now several months later the motor is real noisy. The unit still works but its way too loud. Update: It’s still working well over a year now. If I have the trap on level surface it stays quiet. I also blow out the inside with canned air every few months. It does collect mosquitoes. Many others have stated that it does not but it does. Also this unit is only for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: MFiat

customer_reviews.title: Solved our fly/mosquito problem!
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonders on mosquitoes, flies and moths in our backyard/home. We have a toddler who loves to leave the back door open and lets countless flies in. We leave this on 24/7 and had a get together last night in our backyard. I usually have at least 7 mosquito bites within 5 minutes of being outside at night, and didn't get even one using this... no flies in the house either. So thankful we finally purchased this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Shoup

customer_reviews.title: These are great traps to use indoors
customer_reviews.text: These are great traps to use indoors. They are whisper quiet & require very little attention. I live in an area located between 2 of the remaining rain forests which of course is paradise for mosquitoes . Regardless of how careful you are several manage to sneak into my home. Fruit flies or gnats are a problem as well in this humidity. These traps emit a small amount of uv light which the little buggers can't resist exploring. The fan sucks them into the trap & they die from lack of food & water. These small traps use very little electric so cost of operation is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Hihky effective bug trapper
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly gross. The amount of bugs it catches is crazy. We hung it in our garage which houses our garbage cans. This is mostly ok except in the summer when bugs are active. With the Dynatrap, our garage was literally bug-free. So forgetting about suction, carbon attraction or all that other nonsense, this thing catches lots and lots of bugs and gives you a bug free environment. Which is what you're really looking for she you're buying something like this anyway.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I haven't noticed a huge difference after using this product, but I also don't think I had as much of a problem with flies as I imagined. Each summer I end up with some beetles in my apartment, along with some other flying insects, and I get a little paranoid. I've seen some other reviewers with clear mosquito problems, and this seems like an effective product. This is also affordable and doesn't make too much noise. Seems worth the buy if you have an actual insect problem.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all - Followed instruction to the letter -
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all - Followed instruction to the letter - Even darken the room to where it was the only light source for a week, one bag inside and misquotes and other smaller bugs still buzzing around. Bought the 4-bulb big Florescent light zipper and it works great. This product does not work
customer_reviews.author: P. Burt

customer_reviews.title: It works in our confined space
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our two car garage, hoping to keep mosquitoes away. I have not seen one flying mosquito in the garage, but several are in the trap along with a lot of little moths. EDIT: The fan stopped working. I had saved the warranty card, so I phoned and spoke with a nice person. She expedited a replacement unit at no charge. It arrived today along with a UPS return label. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the bad reviews. Misuse is thier problem.
customer_reviews.text: For the $30 spent this is great. People comaining didn't read the description. It isn't meant to run 24/7 all year long. It is meant to be used when camping or sitting around outside at night. Put it 5 ft from the group and it will do it's job. If you are looking for full time use buy the big ones. I tried it on my front porch over night and it caught: mosquitos, jun bugs, moths, nats, mayflies, and others.
customer_reviews.author: a startz

customer_reviews.title: The plastic cover seems to fall off easily when you keep opening the lid
customer_reviews.text: It does its job by sucking the flies into the trap. But it just takes awhile and also the cord that comes with it is too short for me to place it at a far distance. So I kind of just wait until the fly gets stuck in here and then dump it out. The plastic cover seems to fall off easily when you keep opening the lid. Just be aware of that and make sure to tighten it or else it could fall out. (it has happened to me couple of times)
customer_reviews.author: George Chen

customer_reviews.title: Anti insect trap
customer_reviews.text: The Dynatrap has helped the flying beastie problem on my porch somewhat but its smallish size is a bit overwhelmed by the horde . I have other defenses such as a zapper at one end of the porch planted mint , geraniums and citronella candles and I have found that for some reason coconut oil on exposed areas of skin seems to help to ward off the plague of harpies. Hope that helps.
customer_reviews.author: John Lowell

customer_reviews.title: No more bites from "No see ums"
customer_reviews.text: Was literally getting eaten alive on my backyard patio by "no see ums" and had tried everything to get rid or repel them and nothing worked. Bought the Dynatrap and have not gotten bit by a no see um once in almost the 3 weeks we've had it. Once its little bulb burns out will definitely spend the extra money and get a bigger one with replaceable bulbs. This thing is amazing and I highly recommend it! Great price too and it came in two days after ordering and I ordered it standard free shipping!
customer_reviews.author: A Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a month
customer_reviews.text: DId was it said it would for a month, motor blew after one month of operation. Company has no desire to make good on their crap product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work at about zero %
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a few gnats and or fruit flies and an occupational house fly in my small home office. This thing has been running non-stop for a few weeks and has trapped zero. Save you money and buy a fly swatter.
customer_reviews.author: rsereday

customer_reviews.title: Effective for inside use
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We use a few of these inside our house because about 20 mosquitos fly in when we open the door just to go in or out. We live in Houston. The mosquitos are bad. It does not catch all of them but it has drastically reduced them. We no longer get bitten while sleeping because the ones trapped in the house eventually make their way to the trap. The fan makes a soft humming sound which does not bother me at all. Also, it is like a night light for our kids. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: As of now I can't recommend this product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just bought and received this. I have been using all day and night for 4 days and I have caught nothing but a few moths. As of now I can't recommend this product for the price. If you want something to get rid of moths then this works but so far I have not even captured one mosquito and that is why I bought the thing in the first place. I live in Florida and there are mosquitos everywhere at mostly any time of the day. I have gone out on my porch after the lamp has run for hours and instantly get lit up by mosquitos. Not for the the flying blood suckers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer #1

customer_reviews.title: Texas mosquitoes didn't stand a chance!
customer_reviews.text: Was heading to south Texas after the hurricane and knew the mosquito population was horrible so boughtvtwo of these as a proactive measure. We plugged one in on the back patio where everyone hangs out and one in our attached garage. We leave it plugged in 24/7 and other than the poor little gecko that crawled in and got his head caught in the fan blades ~ these appear to be working!!
customer_reviews.author: bkgrigsby725

customer_reviews.title: CONFLICTING INSTRUCTIONS! DON’T GET THIS WET!
customer_reviews.text: The included instructions say explicitly to place this in the yard away from your house, and at the same time says to only use indoors. It even comes with a diagram illustrating a yard and showing to plce this away from the house!! Yet, nowhere in the instructions does it say that this will break with a little bit of rain. The build quality feels very cheap, but for the two hours it worked it did catch a few mosquitoes and moths. Inexcusable oversights in the instructions. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I have not seen this product to work
customer_reviews.text: I know i have mosquitos laughing at me right now. I was excited about getting this product. But I have used this item for 2 days now, and I have yet to see any mosquitoes land in the trap. Yet I have seen mosquitoes still flying around. So I will give it a few more days, and if no results then I will ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph V

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for mosquitos and gnats in a smaller room - quiet and unobtrusive, doesn't affect conversations but still captures mosquitos and gnats that fly close enough to be attracted and sucked in. You just need to make sure you wait long enough for bugs to die before opening - we opened them to see if they were actually catching anything, and all the bugs flew out. Whoops.
customer_reviews.author: Act162This

customer_reviews.title: Fails after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in the middle of July, 2017. The item seemed to work fine. As per the instructions, I left it on, all the time. About 2 weeks ago, well past the warranty period, I noticed that the fan had stopped working. The light on the unit is still on, but without the fan, it isn't pulling in any insects. And so it has stopped working. I don't know when it actually stopped, but for an item that costs this much, it really should not fail after only four and a half months.
customer_reviews.author: Chetan Sawhney

customer_reviews.title: Works great but dies within 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Really seems to kill the bugs! However within the first week of having it on it died. After contacting seller and being told to try to mess w the fuse (which I couldn't figure out) I was told to contact manufacturing. Well I'm just going to return it hopefully. My friend purchased the giant $140 one and loved it! But it too has died but hers was 3 weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Did absolutely nothing for me. Didn't catch anything. Completely empty.
customer_reviews.author: Nita Parker

customer_reviews.title: Mostly just catches moths. Lots of moths
customer_reviews.text: Good little product, works great catches some larger bugs but mostly just moths when I empty the tray. Shrug. Does its job I guess? Just never seem to find any mosquitos in it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Drum

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: This really helped solve our mosquito problem. They were coming into the apartment from the front door. We put this in the entry way and it caught literally hundreds of them. Quiet and does not smell.
customer_reviews.author: Greg McNutt

customer_reviews.title: I am in LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I am in LOVE! Bought 2 of these and the picture is after 3 days of use. They are each on our deck that is about 25 feet long. I have one on each end and they really seem to cut down on the amount of bugs hitting me in the face. It really does catch and kill things! After 10 days of use one of the fans shut off. I need to clean the dead bug goo out already. Thrilled with these! I only wish these were a tiny bit cheaper so I could order 10 more to have everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: It looks like some sort of zapper but in fact
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious. I bought it and...it works.. It looks like some sort of zapper but in fact, it simply attracts and sucks the flying pest into a holding cell if you will. Once there with the constant positive air pressure, the buggers dry out. Pun intended. They use a small fan like you might find in your computer to create areas of low pressure (input) and high pressure (holding cell) to keep them contained. This is great if you want to use it inside your house to attract and capture those flying little gnats or mozzies.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Oh my goodness - it's NEVER worked!
customer_reviews.text: I realized today that my dynatrap simply has never worked. I had it plugged in outside all this time, and now I realize the light and fan have never come on! Now it's too late to send back, but for the rest of you, be careful and really test before leaving it to do it's job. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Techla

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch bugs
customer_reviews.text: After using this consistently for two months, both indoors and outdoors, I can say with confidence that this doesn't attract any bugs except tiny moths. It never once caught a single mosquito or fly. It didn't even catch fruit flies when placed directly near the fruit.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton Strine

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for over 90 days now. It hasn't caught a bug that we have seen. After 90 days the light quit working. The warranty excludes the light bulb after 90 days. Sorely disappointed because I had high hopes for this discreet little thing.
customer_reviews.author: adoxey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me at all.
customer_reviews.text: Just didn't work, annoyed I missed my opportunity to return. Kept hoping it would work. Followed all instructions to use, and just didn't work. I actually purchased some outlet bug zappers from amazon, and those worked great! Never caught a single thing in this one. Caught flies/mosquitos/nats in my outlet zappers I purchased. Placed in the same area, same conditions, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Cute but does not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Here in North Texas we have been inundated with mosquitoes all summer. So many that sitting outside is impossible. Quite a few in doors as well. I ran this device per instructions 24/7 for 2 weeks. It trapped a few silver moths outdoors but not one mosquito..Maybe I can get 2 bucks for it in a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: sideliner

customer_reviews.title: WELL, THAT’S WHAT I GET for giving the product time to be effective
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that it doesn’t work!! I continued using hoping to catch more than 5 bugs but it didn’t happen. I live in an extremely bug ridden tropical island and this thing couldn’t trap more than 5 bugs in a month! Now when I want to return it, they tell me ITS TOO LATE!
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Indoor use only
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for deck use only to discover that it is intended for indoor use only. This information is Indioor use only is not indicated on the outside of the box, nor do I remember reading it in the Amazon description, so I’m feeling a bit flim-flammed. I will try the device out in my bedroom and if it works well may purchase the larger and more expensive outdoor version.
customer_reviews.author: JJ DeMauro

customer_reviews.title: I loved the advertisement for the product but I returned it
customer_reviews.text: It did not do all the: nat, fly and mosquito catching it "promised" to do. Very elegant features, esthetically speaking. We returned it without any problems. Disappointed that it did not work as well as we hoped as it is a Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: and all of them went right into it in one night like a Ghostbusters trap
customer_reviews.text: TRAPS ASIAN LADYBEETLES! I had a bunch of those nasty ladybug imposters get in somehow from an attic vent, and you can't squash them because they stink. I hung this up, turned it on, and all of them went right into it in one night like a Ghostbusters trap. Recommended for that.
customer_reviews.author: Winterlynx

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: This is a device that has to be placed in the perimeter of your space. If you put it on a table surrounded by people. You’re going to get bit. That being said, it’s it very effective. Not worth the money. Lemongrass oil works better
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Lyness

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: If you have indoor mosquitoes this REALLY catches a lot of them! BUT keep it separate from other light sources,because it's the light that attracts them. I have this one and a larger one. I'd be a pin cushion if not for the Dynatraps. I have told everyone I know to get them, Houston is a swamp and we're infested down here with those little nasty ones that see you before you see them. Every time I clean out the trap I get a look at what it saved me from. Seriously, THANK YOU, DYNATRAP! If I could afford it I'd buy two more.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really work, it's small and it does nothing to mosquitoes, it only catches some butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: It does work
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this when I bought it, but if you live in a warm, humid area where there are lots of "no seeums" and gnats this does catch a bunch of them. It needs to be placed in an area that is dark at night so they are attracted to the light and they don't all get caught "instantly". But after a few weeks of use I opened mine up and, sure enough, there were a bunch of dead bugs in it.
customer_reviews.author: docj

customer_reviews.title: I’m torn with this unit. Can’t tell if it’s working
customer_reviews.text: I’m honestly torn with this item. I have this and the 1 acre outdoor trap. I think I have caught every bug in the forest around my house but very little with this. I can’t tell if it is work cause I never catch anything but it could also be the outside unit is doing so good there is nothing left to trap. I never see anything to catch so that could be the reason it’s always empty
customer_reviews.author: S. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: It works. I have a real mosquito problem in ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. I have a real mosquito problem in my garage and back porch and in about one week of use I can see the little monsters down there in the collector. Highly recommendo.
customer_reviews.author: SquirrelCutter

customer_reviews.title: WORKS to kill fleas as well as flies, gnats, mosquitoes, bees, wasps, etc
customer_reviews.text: We turn it on in our home every nite and it’s killed the flea issue. Our yard got infested over the summer & we’d find 5+ fleas in our home everyday even though I was washing everything nearly daily. So I started leaving this trap on the floor at nite and it attracted fleas, flies, gnats, everything and zapped them. Soon we stopped finding fleas in the home.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Ka’uhane

customer_reviews.title: I like it. So quiet and light
customer_reviews.text: I like it. So quiet and light. Very easy to travel and pack. However, I don't think it covers half an acre. I put it through ultimate test and brought it to my house in Costa Rica. It didn't work that great outside so I put it in my house for the bugs that snuck in. Indoors, it works fantastic!! I'm sure the bigger ones would be fine outside. There are some aggressive mosquitos in Costa Rica, really nothing works there. It's too bad it's plug in only. I would've liked to have hung it in a tree. October 2017 UPDATE: Still works, still awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chopstick007

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Expect the bug remains to at some point stop up the fan, but emptying the tray, cleaning out the fan with a can of dust remover did it for me. Tapping out stuck bugs and you're back in business! No mosquitos!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It does attract the insects and works well. I used this inside. We had these pesky little no-see-ums (yes that’s really a bug 0.03 inches long) with a mean bite. The fan died after a couple of weeks, but they were very quick to replace it at no charge!
customer_reviews.author: BlessedJoy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: It works well for moths and some flies. I bought this for the mosquitoes and it might catch maybe one mosquito for every hundred moths. My backyard is infested with mosquitoes, so I definitely would say it's ineffective on mosquitoes, but fine for moths. Update: died after 2 months. Not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Morgan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small areas!
customer_reviews.text: It works! I was skeptical because UV doesn’t attract mosquitoes but I have a small area under my patio that mosquitoes just love to hover around by my back door. So I placed this in that area so it could suck the mosquitoes in at least. And it works! It doesn’t get all of them but the fact it helps those little monsters from breeding more is satisfaction for me. I live in south Louisiana where they are really bad here. So I am considering getting another one or a bigger version so I can actually enjoy the evenings under my patio again. Pics are proof enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Lue

customer_reviews.title: Won't work for no see ums or tiny bugs
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty small, quiet, easy to set up. Just got it so we'll see how it performs overnight. I may return because I got it for a swarm of no see ums like it said it catches but the netting is clearly too big for these buggers to not escape through. Maybe it'll keep back a large gnat.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year. I have it hanging on my back porch constantly running. I will turn it off and close it up for a day every 1-2 weeks to empty it out. It is always filled with mosquitoes moths and other kinds of bugs. It works better than I thought it would. I live in Georgia so of course there is no shortage of mosquitoes around here. This doesn't do the job all on its own but in conjunction with everything else I do to combat the mosquitoes it helps. I do wish it would attract gnats and flies.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Will KILL MOSQUITOES!
customer_reviews.text: After trying two other bug zapping devices and returning those I bought this to hopefully kill mosquitoes. I can happily say that this thing worked great. I was skeptical at first after being let down by the other two devices but I was amazed when I saw dead mosquitoes in the trap. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Easy, Hasn't worked well for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and does seem to attract insects. I have not had the same luck as other reviewers and probably only catch between 3-4 bugs a night. So far no mosquitoes which is what I really wanted to catch, mainly moths and small fruit flies. I guess I'm just a much better attractant for the mosquitos than this little lamp. Damn. The vacuum is very quiet and I have no problem keeping it in my room while I'm sleeping. I also like that I can let the bugs go outside when my conscience gets the better of me. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Porch Patrol
customer_reviews.text: Porch patrol is my main wish. We sit on our porch at night until bedtime. Catches many bugs, but the occasional gnat gets through. I know because I am allergic to gnat bites. They really Itch! Makes a lovely romantic glow without the glare of a bulb or outdoor light. Easy to empty and install--just plug in.
customer_reviews.author: ColoGma

customer_reviews.title: Better off just getting a quiet zapper unless you are ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a mosquito trap. If you do your research, Mosquitos are not attracted to ultraviolet light which is what this trap uses to get them in. You will mostly find moths and other random insects in there. AND they are all not dead. They just sit in there until they eventually die. But when u go to empty it they will just fly out again. Better off just getting a quiet zapper unless you are trying to collect bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: not great for asian lady beetles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Asian lady beetles that were getting into my sun room. It simply doesn't seem to work well for this species. If I'm lucky I catch one a night (i use it at night so that it is the only light on in the room). This may work for mosquitoes, I don't know I haven't tried that yet, but if you are getting this for these obnoxious invasive beetles you might be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lorax

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome..
customer_reviews.text: Even with a yellow bulb my porch light attracts a swarm of moths, and every time I open the door to let the dog out and in, they come inside. My house was starting to look like something out of a horror movie. So I get this little trap and set it up on my kitchen counter, shut off the lights and go into the living room to watch TV. For the next half hour I hear.. tink tink tink tunk tink tunk coming from the kitchen. I go in to check and when look through the screen of the base there were 15-20 of those gross buggers in there. YAH!!
customer_reviews.author: wolfeyes_6

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, works great for indoors, will work outdoors as well
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a mosquito catching machine. I clean it out once a month, and I see hundreds if not thousands of skeeters in the trap each time. It makes basically no noise, and produces very little visible light. Amazing performance for the price. It works with 3 methods, c02 attractant, light attractant, and heat attractant.
customer_reviews.author: M. Makam

customer_reviews.title: No Zika virus in my neighborhood!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bigger trap for the front porch and because it is doing so good a job I bought the ultralight, which is placed on the back entrance to the house. These traps speak value, no mosquitoes, no beetles, NO BUGS! I can sit on my porch at any time and not worry about getting bitten or stung. I clean the trap every Saturday and is hard to believe how many critters land inside, that's what I call fatal attraction, by the way cleaning is easy, highly recommend the Dynatrap. My neighbors are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap Ultralight Insect Trap
customer_reviews.text: Finally an insect trap that does exactly what it claims to do! The unit is small, has a light that attracts bugs, a fan to suck and keep them in. It also has a cage at the bottom with screens so you can see what you have caught. Fan is fairly quiet. The units bulb is not replaceable, so when it goes out you just buy a new unit. The build quality feels very light duty and probably wouldn't survive a fall. I use mine inside and it works great catching insects that make it into the house.
customer_reviews.author: TRUMP 2020

customer_reviews.title: The Trap works.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in two days and saved our bacon. We were both going nuts with the no-see-ums on our boat. We had been anchored out about 3/4 of a mile off shore from mango trees and completely spoiled from having no bugs. We went into a marina in Monroe County in the keys and literally got attacked. We hung the trap up and with in a couple of hours there were no more no-see-ums in our salon. I highly recommend this for any room you want cleared out of bugs.
customer_reviews.author: james t holtzinger

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Asian Beetles
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cope with an infestation of Asian Beetles. Set up per instructions with baffle open during use. Out of the scores of bugs on our west windows, the Dynatrap has manged to catch only a couple dozen over the past month.
customer_reviews.author: HarryandLynne

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, quiet, effective
customer_reviews.text: This was the least expensive DynaTrap I. Oils find. I wanted to know if it really worked before buying a 1/4 or 1/2 acre size. Well, I’m here to tell you it works great. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: I had such high hopes for this trap for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this trap for my mosquito and moth problem. However, I watch bugs fly right by without a second glance. I do believe that a handful of bugs have been trapped; however, the base is so shoddily made that when I try to move the trap, the bottom falls out as do the dead bugs. Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Wen

customer_reviews.title: Really Good product from the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, works better than as described inside and outside. This works so good until I purchased two of them. I put one in the Garage, and the other on the Front Porch. Since installing them I have less problem's with Mosquito and other bugs. My wife wants to purchase one more bigger one to cover all outdoors areas.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY W. DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Working better than other options so far
customer_reviews.text: Night 1: Caught about 10 fruit flies Night 2: 0 fruit flies (saw at least 3 in the kitchen) + 1 mosquito (I accidentally let in earlier) Night 3: 0. Still a few fruit flies in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, It was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of the traps, one for home and one for the office. The device looks great. The concept sounds like it should work. In actual use it doesn't do much of anything. Caught 1 fly and a couple mosquitos between the 2 devices. (I left them on 24/7)Around September and October there are lots of flys in our area, I was hoping this would work to catch them. Possibly adding an attractant would make them actually work. I would not recommend purchasing this unless they upgrade it in some way that actually works. I rated 2 stars because it does work as a cool looking knick knack.
customer_reviews.author: Unwired

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Update to previous comments. The company very quickly sent me out a new Dynatrap when I contacted them. It was under warranty, but I am still impressed at how easy the process was. I'm looking forward to catching a bunch of mosquitoes again. I actually really liked my Dynatrap. It caught lots of mosquitoes and some other pests as well. Unfortunately, it broke after just 7 weeks of use. It was working perfectly fine. I unplugged it to go on vacation for a week and when I came back it just won't power up. I cannot recommend for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works for more than just mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Does trap those little flying critters that come into the home on fruit and other produce. Works great, especially over night. Device is designed so that the insects can remain trapped after the power is turned off. Wait for them to die before emptying or deal with them your own favorite way.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L

product_meta.title: DynaTrap DT150 Ultralight Insect Trap, 300 Square Feet, Midnight Blue
product_meta.description: Size:300 Square FeetGet relief from flying insects in small indoor spaces with the DynaTrap DT150 ultralight indoor insect trap. Proven to attract, trap, & kill mosquitoes, biting flies, wasps, stink bugs, Asian beetles, & more, This indoor trap’s three-way system Lures flying insects with a warm UV light & Carbon dioxide. A whisper-quiet fan then draws mosquitoes into the screened base & traps them until they dehydrate & die--without the use of harmful chemicals or pesticides. Ideal for use in garages, RVs, patios, & screened-in porches, this Travel-sized mosquito trap Coversup to 300 square'. Its lightweight, compact design makes it easy to set up anywhere. The included UV bulb is rated for 20, 000 hours & is not replaceable.
feature_bullets: No Zapping or Buzzing. No expensive attractant required.
Recommended for indoor and protected outdoor use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars1,471 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
